s.text: Seems that at the Madrid NATO meetings, while Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien was kept waiting for a tardy President Clinton, he vented a bit about Clinton to some European leaders, and a television network's audio system picked up his comments.

Instead, Sullivan explained, the "coffees were a tool in helping us motivate and energize the people that we needed to motivate and energize to help us raise the $130 million that we wanted to raise."
